title: Viscountess Weymouth shows off generous side by handing £10 to Big Issue seller
text:
Good to see that Viscountess Weymouth has a keen sense of noblesse oblige.

Strictly Come Dancing contestant Emma - who is married to Longleat heir Ceawlin Thynn, the Marquess of Bath's son - encountered a Big Issue seller as she left a Mayfair reception on Monday.

The magazine for the homeless costs £2.50 but she handed the vendor a £10 note, explaining: 'Sorry, that's all I've got.'

She didn't ask for change.

Strictly Come Dancing contestant Emma (pictured) - who is married to Longleat heir Ceawlin Thynn, the Marquess of Bath's son - encountered a Big Issue seller as she left a Mayfair reception on Monday. The magazine for the homeless costs £2.50 but she handed the vendor a £10 note, explaining: 'Sorry, that's all I've got.' She didn't ask for change

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Cover up darling, Craig tells Bruno

While social media is full of beautiful young people showing off their bodies, Bruno Tonioli has upset his fellow Strictly judge Craig Revel Horwood with his revealing selfies.

‘He had a good body when he was in Elton John’s I’m Still Standing video, but that was 30 years ago, darling,’ Revel Horwood tells me at the Pride Of Britain awards. ‘He should learn to start covering up.

There should be a limit to what he is showing people, I think.’ The choreographer, 54, adds of the 63-year-old: ‘Bruno is in love with himself and his body. He thinks he has got the body of a 23-year-old.’

While social media is full of beautiful young people showing off their bodies, Bruno Tonioli (pictured right) has upset his fellow Strictly judge Craig Revel Horwood (pictured left) with his revealing selfies

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BBC director-general Tony Hall has surprised Corporation insiders by accepting a new outside role as Trustee of the National Gallery.

‘You’d think Tony had enough on his plate here with the gender pay gap row and the battle against Netflix,’ says one, who suspects Hall might find a soft landing as chair of the gallery when his eventful BBC tenure ends.

He’d certainly be in the frame.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Adele's sleek new look has won the backing of Alison Moyet, the Eighties star who blazed the trail for larger-than-life women singers. ‘People telling Adele she won’t sing as well for losing a stone,’ Moyet says. ‘Bo****ks.

Us fat girls weren’t put on the world to make talentless people feel better.’

Recently separated Adele, 31, has lost 3st with a combination of Reformer Pilates with friend Ayda Field, working out to Joe Wicks videos and a diet featuring kale and buckwheat.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

How can any artist capture the full awfulness of the Squeaker?’ muses my man in the gallery, who feels that perhaps only the Norwegian — whose most famous work is The Scream — could have done Bercow justice

Tomorrow is supposedly John Bercow’s final day as Speaker.

Perhaps that’s what prompted an unusual sight in one of the side galleries overlooking the Commons chamber yesterday — an artist toiling away with charcoal or pencil.‘

How can any artist capture the full awfulness of the Squeaker?’ muses my man in the gallery, who feels that perhaps only the Norwegian — whose most famous work is The Scream — could have done Bercow justice.

‘We need Edvard Munch.’

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Queen’s close aide Angela Kelly held the launch party last night for her book about dressing the monarch, The Other Side Of The Coin.

The bash was at The Goring, a gemstone’s throw from Buckingham Palace. Miss Kelly has a close affiliation with the hotel through organising Her Majesty’s annual Christmas parties for her household staff.

While some authors send out boring press releases to publicise their books, she gave journalists a useful pack of needle, thread, scissors and a thimble.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Amanda's 'sex chair' will spook Tories

Socialite Amanda Eliasch is throwing a racy Tory fundraiser at her Chelsea home for Halloween. She recently sold many of her furnishings, but still has one of her £10,000 sex chairs (pictured). ‘I’ll get it out for the party. The MPs can have fun with it.’ Ugh!

Who says politics is scary? Socialite Amanda Eliasch is throwing a racy Tory fundraiser at her Chelsea home for Halloween.

‘I’m told Jeremy Hunt will be there, but I’m not in charge of the guest list,’ she tells me.

‘We’re all dressing up and I’ll be Morticia from the Addams Family.’

She’s co-hosting the party with photographer Alison Jackson, who specialises in celebrity lookalikes. ‘I’m not sure if it will be the real Jeremy Hunt,’ Amanda says.

‘I would prefer the fake one.’

She recently sold many of her furnishings, but still has one of her £10,000 sex chairs (pictured).

‘I’ll get it out for the party. The MPs can have fun with it.’ Ugh!

authors: Sebastian Shakespeare For The Daily Mail
